&   

NetBSD-SoC: SASL client library

What is it | Status | Repository | Deliverables | Documentation | Technical details | Contact

What is it?

This is the historical site of the project used during the Google Summer of Code 2010. For recent info check the main page.

Status

Project schedule:
  • April 26, 2010: Community Bonding Period -- Students get to know mentors, read documentation, get up to speed to begin working on their projects.
  • week 1, May 24 - May 31:
    • May 24, 2010: Students begin coding for their GSoC projects; Google begins issuing initial student payments
    • implementing API
    • writing weekly report
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing test cases
  • week 2, May 31 - June 7:
    • implementing API
    • implementing ANONYMOUS, EXTERNAL, PLAIN
    • writing example client
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing weekly report
    • writing test cases
  • week 3, June 14 - June 21:
    • implementing CRAM-MD5
    • writing example client
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing weekly report
    • writing test cases
  • week 4, June 21 - June 28:
    • implementing DIGEST-MD5
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing weekly report
    • writing test cases
  • week 5, June 28 - July 5:
    • implementing DIGEST-MD5
    • writing weekly report
    • writing test cases
  • week 6, July 5 - July 12:
    • implementing DIGEST-MD5
    • refactoring and fixing code
    • writing weekly report
    • writing test cases
    • writing mid-term report
  • week 7, July 12 - July 19:
    • July 12, 2010: Mentors and students can begin submitting mid-term evaluations.
    • July 16, 2010: Mid-term evaluation deadline; Google begins issuing mid-term student payments provided passing student survey is on file.
    • implementing GSSAPI
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing weekly report
    • writing test cases
  • week 8, July 19 - July 26:
    • implementing GSSAPI
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing weekly report
    • writing test cases
  • week 9, July 26 - August 2:
    • implementing GSSAPI
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing weekly report
    • testing/fixing
  • week 10, August 2 - August 9:
    • writing manpages/documentation
    • writing weekly report
    • testing/fixing
  • week 11, August 9 - August 16:
    • August 9, 2010: Suggested 'pencils down' date. Take a week to scrub code, write tests, improve documentation, etc.
    • August 16, 2010: Firm 'pencils down' date. Mentors, students and organization administrators can begin submitting final evaluations to Google.
    • writing weekly report
    • writing final report
    • vacations
  • August 20, 2010: Final evaluation deadline; Google begins issuing student and mentoring organization payments provided forms and evaluations are on file.
Major milestones:
  • detailed library design
  • API with one mechanism
  • configuration files parser
  • PLAIN/EXTERNAL/LOGIN/ANONYMOUS mechanisms
  • example client (stdio/stdout)
  • example client (SMTP/IMAP)
  • CRAM-MD5 mechanism
  • DIGEST-MD5 mechanism
  • GSSAPI mechanism
  • manpages/documentation

Project's repository

Project is aviliable via CVS, anonymous read-only access is provided. Run following command for accessing the repository:

cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@netbsd-soc.cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/netbsd-soc checkout -P sasl_client_lib

Deliverables

Mandatory (must-have) components:
  • library code:
    • API implementation
    • ANONYMOUS mechanism
    • CRAM-MD5 mechanism
    • DIGEST-MD5 mechanism
    • EXTERNAL mechanism
    • GSSAPI mechanism
    • LOGIN mechanism
    • PLAIN mechanism
  • example usage (SMTP/IMAP client)
  • manpages for the library
  • test cases
Optional component:

Documentation

Standards:
  • RFC2195 - IMAP/POP AUTHorize Extension for Simple Challenge/Response (CRAM-MD5)
  • RFC2222 - Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL, GSSAPI, EXTERN)
  • RFC2245 - Anonymous SASL Mechanism (ANONYMOUS)
  • RFC2595 - Using TLS with IMAP, POP3 and ACAP (PLAIN)
  • RFC2831 - Using Digest Authentication as a SASL Mechanism (DIGEST-MD5)
Related libraries:
  • Cyrus-SASL - Cyrus Simple Authentication and Security Layer library
  • Libgsasl - GNU Simple Authentication and Security Layer library

Technical Details

Testing:
  • ATF - Automated Testing Framework

Contact

If you've got any questions or suggestions, then feel free to contact me by e-mail, my address is m.kocielski@gmail.com. You can also contact me more interactively via IRC, my nickname is shm at the freenode network.
